greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Alternating sum of the eighth powers of the first n Fibonacci numbers.
comment: Natural bilateral extension (brackets mark index 0): ..., -16392896, 384320, -6305, 256, 0, 1, 0, [0], -1, 0, -256, 6305, -384320, 16392896, ... This is (-A128698)-reversed followed by A128698.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..595
formula: Let F(n) be the Fibonacci number A000045(n) and let L(n) be the Lucas number A000032(n).
Factored closed form: a(n) = (-1)^n (1/21) F(n-2) F(n) F(n+1) F(n+3) (3 F(n)^2 F(n+1)^2 + 4).
mathematica: a[ n_Integer ] := If[ n >= 0, Sum[ (-1)^k Fibonacci[ k ]^8, {k, 1, n} ], Sum[ -(-1)^k Fibonacci[ -k ]^8, {k, 1, -n - 1} ] ]
program: (MAGMA) [(&+[(-1)^k*Fibonacci(k)^8: k in [0..n]]): n in [0..30]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Jan 17 2018
results.author: _Stuart Clary_, Mar 23 2007
